awd_titl_txt: A General Purpose Neurocomputer : Simulation                and Feasibility
awd_abstract_narration: The existence of a universal neural network, AMNIAC, developed by the           principal investigators for theoretical reasons, raises the                     possibility of implementing a general purpose neurocomputer, i.e., one          which may be "programmed" to behave like any other neural network.              Such general purpose neurocomputers will run different neural networks          on the same hardware like our serial computers run programs today.  A           general purpose neurocomputer should include capabilities beyond those          of a universal neural network.  Most important among these are                  efficient massive storage, rapid retrieval, learning, and                       sophisticated input/output.                                                                                                                                     The goal of this project is to simulate AMNIAC on a massively parallel          computer.  This simulation will allow the design of adequate massive            storage, learning and input/output capabilities.  It will also allow            benchmarks to provide reliable estimates of the feasibility and                 efficiency of an actual general purpose neurocomputer.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
